posts.fact: A duck's quack doesn't echo.
The average person spends 6 months of their lifetime waiting for red traffic lights to turn green.
Cats have five toes on their front paws, but only four toes on their back paws.
An octopus has three hearts.
Ketchup was sold as medicine in the 1830s.
A group of flamingos is called a flamboyance.
The shortest war in history lasted only 38 to 45 minutes.
The average person walks the equivalent of three times around the world in their lifetime.
Honey never spoils. You can eat 3,000-year-old honey and it will still be perfectly edible.
A sneeze travels out of your mouth at over 100 miles per hour.
The average person laughs about 15 times a day.
A cow produces about 200,000 glasses of milk in a lifetime.
A snail can sleep for three years.
Bananas are berries, but strawberries are not.
The average person sheds about 600,000 particles of skin every hour.
Apples float in water because they are made up of 25% air.
The world's oldest known recipe is a beer recipe.
The average person spends 6 months of their life waiting for a red light to turn green.
There is no word in the English language that rhymes with month, orange, silver, or purple.
A single strand of spaghetti is called a -spaghetto.-
The world's oldest piece of chewing gum is over 9,000 years old.
Sloths only poop once a week.
Polar bears are left-handed.
The human brain is more active at night than during the day.
If you lift a kangaroo's tail off the ground, it can't hop.
A group of owls is called a parliament.
